description: 20 prompts covering nested if/else, deep decision trees, Switch on Int/String/Enum, multi-condition logic, combined branch patterns.

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with bool IsAlive and bool HasWeapon. On BeginPlay check IsAlive. If true, check HasWeapon. If has weapon print Armed. If no weapon print Unarmed. If not alive print Dead.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_NestedCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsAlive: Bool = true
VAR HasWeapon: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsAlive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=HasWeapon]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Armed"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Unarmed"]
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Dead"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n7.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n8.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with float Health. On BeginPlay if Health > 75 print Healthy. Else if Health > 25 print Wounded. Else print Critical.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthStatus
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 50.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n3: GreaterThan [B=75.0]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Healthy"]
NODE n6: GreaterThan [B=25.0]
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Wounded"]
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Critical"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
EXEC n4.False -> n7.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
EXEC n7.False -> n9.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer Level. On BeginPlay use Switch on Int. Case 1 prints Easy. Case 2 prints Medium. Case 3 prints Hard. Default prints Unknown.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DifficultySwitch
PARENT: Actor
VAR Level: Int = 1
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Level]
NODE n3: SwitchOnInt
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Easy"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Medium"]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Hard"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Unknown"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Selection [Int]
EXEC n3.Case_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_2 -> n5.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_3 -> n6.Execute
EXEC n3.Default -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string Command. On BeginPlay use Switch on String. If Attack print Attacking. If Defend print Defending. If Heal print Healing. Default print Idle.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CommandSwitch
PARENT: Actor
VAR Command: String = "Attack"
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Command]
NODE n3: SwitchOnString
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Attacking"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Defending"]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Healing"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Idle"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Selection [String]
EXEC n3.Case_Attack -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_Defend -> n5.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_Heal -> n6.Execute
EXEC n3.Default -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with bool HasKey and bool DoorUnlocked. On overlap, if HasKey AND DoorUnlocked print Enter. Else print Blocked.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DoorCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR HasKey: Bool = true
VAR DoorUnlocked: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=HasKey]
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=DoorUnlocked]
NODE n4: BooleanAND
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Enter"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Blocked"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.A [Bool]
DATA n3.Value -> n4.B [Bool]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with bool IsInvisible. On Tick, if NOT IsInvisible, print Visible.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_VisCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsInvisible: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsInvisible]
NODE n3: NOT
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Visible"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Input [Bool]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap casts to Character. If cast succeeds check distance less than 200. If close print Too Close. If far print In Range. If cast fails print Not Player.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RangeCheck
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: CastToCharacter
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=200.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Too Close"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="In Range"]
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Not Player"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Object [Actor]
EXEC n2.CastSucceeded -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.AsCharacter -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n7.Execute
EXEC n2.CastFailed -> n8.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with float PlayerHealth and float EnemyHealth. On BeginPlay if PlayerHealth greater than EnemyHealth print Advantage. Else print Disadvantage.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthCompare
PARENT: Actor
VAR PlayerHealth: Float = 80.0
VAR EnemyHealth: Float = 60.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=PlayerHealth]
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=EnemyHealth]
NODE n4: GreaterThan
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Advantage"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Disadvantage"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n3.Value -> n4.B [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer WeaponSlot. On pressing Fire, switch on WeaponSlot. Case 1 prints Sword. Case 2 prints Bow. Case 3 prints Staff.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_WeaponSelect
PARENT: Actor
VAR WeaponSlot: Int = 1
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=WeaponSlot]
NODE n3: SwitchOnInt
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Sword"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Bow"]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Staff"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Selection [Int]
EXEC n3.Case_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_2 -> n5.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_3 -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with float Health at 100. Start a looping timer every 2 seconds. Each tick subtract 10. If Health > 50 print OK. Else if Health > 0 print Warning. Else clear timer and print Dead.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthDrain
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Drain", Time=2.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=Drain]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n5: SubtractFloat [B=10.0]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n7: GreaterThan [B=50.0]
NODE n8: Branch
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="OK"]
NODE n10: GreaterThan [B=0.0]
NODE n11: Branch
NODE n12: PrintString [InString="Warning"]
NODE n13: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Drain"]
NODE n14: PrintString [InString="Dead"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Float]
EXEC n6.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.A [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n8.True -> n9.Execute
EXEC n8.False -> n11.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n10.A [Float]
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n11.True -> n12.Execute
EXEC n11.False -> n13.Execute
EXEC n13.Then -> n14.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer Score. On BeginPlay if Score equals 100 print Perfect. Else print Try Again.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ScoreCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR Score: Int = 100
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Score]
NODE n3: EqualEqual [B=100]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Perfect"]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Try Again"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Int]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
EXEC n4.False -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with bool A, bool B, bool C. On BeginPlay check A. If true check B. If B true check C. If all three true print All True. Each false branch prints the failing variable name.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TripleCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR A: Bool = true
VAR B: Bool = true
VAR C: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=A]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=B]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: VariableGet [VarName=C]
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="All True"]
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="C Failed"]
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="B Failed"]
NODE n11: PrintString [InString="A Failed"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
EXEC n7.False -> n9.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n10.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n11.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer Mode. On BeginPlay switch on Mode. Case 1 sets a 1-second looping timer. Case 2 sets a 5-second looping timer. The timer prints Tick.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ModeTimer
PARENT: Actor
VAR Mode: Int = 1
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Mode]
NODE n3: SwitchOnInt
NODE n4: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=1.0, Looping=true]
NODE n5: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=5.0, Looping=true]
NODE n6: Event_Custom [EventName=OnTick]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Tick"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Selection [Int]
EXEC n3.Case_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_2 -> n5.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with float Value. On BeginPlay if Value greater than 100, set to 100. If less than 0, set to 0. Print the final value.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ClampValue
PARENT: Actor
VAR Value: Float = 150.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Value]
NODE n3: GreaterThan [B=100.0]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=Value]
NODE n6: LessThan [B=0.0]
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: VariableSet [VarName=Value]
NODE n9: VariableGet [VarName=Value]
NODE n10: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
DATA 100.0 -> n5.Value [Float]
EXEC n5.Then -> n10.Execute
EXEC n4.False -> n7.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
DATA 0.0 -> n8.Value [Float]
EXEC n8.Then -> n10.Execute
EXEC n7.False -> n10.Execute
DATA n9.Value -> n10.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with bool IsDay and bool HasTorch. On overlap if IsDay OR HasTorch print Can See. Else print Darkness.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_VisionCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsDay: Bool = false
VAR HasTorch: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsDay]
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=HasTorch]
NODE n4: BooleanOR
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Can See"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Darkness"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.A [Bool]
DATA n3.Value -> n4.B [Bool]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string DamageType and float Armor. On AnyDamage if DamageType equals Fire and Armor less than 50 print Burned. If DamageType equals Fire and armor 50+ print Resisted. If not fire print Hit.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DamageResponse
PARENT: Actor
VAR Armor: Float = 30.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_AnyDamage
NODE n2: EqualEqual [B="Fire"]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=Armor]
NODE n5: LessThan [B=50.0]
NODE n6: Branch
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Burned"]
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Resisted"]
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Hit"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n6.True -> n7.Execute
EXEC n6.False -> n8.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n9.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer EnemyType. On BeginPlay switch on EnemyType. Case 1 spawns BP_Goblin. Case 2 spawns BP_Skeleton. Case 3 spawns BP_Dragon. All spawn at actor location.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_EnemySpawner
PARENT: Actor
VAR EnemyType: Int = 1
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=EnemyType]
NODE n3: SwitchOnInt
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Goblin]
NODE n6: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Skeleton]
NODE n7: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Dragon]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Selection [Int]
EXEC n3.Case_1 -> n5.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_2 -> n6.Execute
EXEC n3.Case_3 -> n7.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.SpawnTransform [Transform]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.SpawnTransform [Transform]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n7.SpawnTransform [Transform]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with float Temperature. On BeginPlay if Temperature less than 0 print Freezing. If between 0 and 30 print Normal. If above 30 print Hot.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TempCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR Temperature: Float = 20.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Temperature]
NODE n3: LessThan [B=0.0]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Freezing"]
NODE n6: GreaterThan [B=30.0]
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Hot"]
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Normal"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
EXEC n4.False -> n7.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
EXEC n7.False -> n9.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor variable Target. On Tick check if Target is valid. If valid check distance less than 500. If close print Tracking. If far print Searching. If invalid print No Target.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TargetStatus
PARENT: Actor
VAR Target: Actor = None
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Target]
NODE n3: IsValid
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: GetDistanceTo
NODE n6: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Tracking"]
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Searching"]
NODE n10: PrintString [InString="No Target"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Input [Object]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n7.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n5.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
EXEC n7.False -> n9.Execute
EXEC n4.False -> n10.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with integer Screen. On pressing Menu switch on Screen. Case 0 creates WBP_MainMenu. Case 1 creates WBP_Inventory. Case 2 creates WBP_Map. Add each to viewport.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ScreenSwitch
PARENT: Actor
VAR Screen: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Menu"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Screen]
NODE n3: SwitchOnInt
NODE n4: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_MainMenu]
NODE n5: AddToViewport
NODE n6: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_Inventory]
NODE n7: AddToViewport
NODE n8: CreateWidget [WidgetClass=WBP_Map]
NODE n9: AddToViewport
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Selection [Int]
EXEC n3.Case_0 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Target [Widget]
EXEC n3.Case_1 -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Target [Widget]
EXEC n3.Case_2 -> n8.Execute
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Target [Widget]
